Job Title: Junior Imagery Analyst

Location: Chantilly, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Description

Are you ready for a rewarding career opportunity?

A brilliant mind is smart, a brilliant team is smarter.

Innovation thrives in the collective. We're embracing the exponential potential of collaborative minds by combining the unique talents and perspectives of our people and partners.

Leidos is an innovation company rapidly addressing the world's most vexing challenges in national security and health. Our 47,000 employees collaborate to create smarter technology solutions for customers in these critical markets.

We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainably. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.

If this sounds like an environment where you can thrive, keep reading!

If you're a skilled Imagery Analyst with at least 3 years of relevant experience looking for your next opportunity, we have an opportunity that you won't want to miss. The FMI Team at Leidos currently has an opening for a Junior Imagery Analyst to work in our Chantilly, VA offices. This is an exciting opportunity to use your experience helping the Foundational Military Intelligence mission. On this work, we support multiple Intel customer missions in fulfilling their responsibility for producing Foundational Military Intelligence Baseline reports. These reports are the foundation of target knowledge and play a critical role in Intel customers building actionable intelligence for the Warfighter and Intelligence community.

This is a chance to be a part of a dynamic group dedicated to providing the BEST to our Intel customers. We value an inclusive and collaborative environment and are excited to offer you a professional growth journey singularly focused on delivering world-class solutions. You'll have the chance to work directly with our customers and be given the opportunity to grow and develop your skills in a fast-paced and rewarding environment.

Primary Responsibilities

The candidate will work with team members. The candidate must be able to create, research, evaluate, analyze, and fuse data from multiple sources and datasets to produce current and finished geospatial intelligence products. The Imagery Analyst will prepare geospatial products to an established Intel customer production standard. In this position the analyst may also assist in the development and documentation of imagery analysis procedures, and maintenance of products.

Basic Qualifications

Active TS/SCI with ability to obtain and maintain TS/SCI Polygraph.HS Diploma and at least 3+ years of relevant imagery analysis experience.Ability to produce dynamic GEOINT products to customer standard.Strong knowledge of soft copy exploitation and multi-spectral exploitation functionalities.Strong knowledge of the following systems and software programs: REMOTEVIEW, IEC, NES, and common office software to include PowerPoint presentations, spreadsheets, and word processing.Ability to incorporate multiple data sources.Proficiency in MS Office suite.Strong time management skills.Willingness to work 2nd shift as necessary.

Preferred Qualifications

Demonstrated ability to work in a very dynamic and demanding work environment.Demonstrated ability to work cooperatively as a team member and provide guidance to government Intelligence customer analysts to build effective customer relationships.Experienced in writing and crafting intelligence reports for serialized reporting.BS and 2+ years of relevant experience

Original Posting Date

2024-04-19

While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

Pay Range

Pay Range $55,250.00 - $99,875.00

The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

#Featuredjob

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
